newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - BTP failure above 129 points to pullback.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - BTP failure above 129 points to pullback.

text.p: June BTP futures on LIFFE are likely to retain a soft undertone on Thursday after the market stopped at 129.00 exactly early in the session, technical analysts said.
"Today's failure to hold over 129.00 suggests a pullback to 128.60-40," said Francoise Skelley, head of global trading technical analysis at Credit Suisse First Boston in London.
She said there was an hourly upchannel line there and it was also an upbreak point.
June BTPs at 0750 GMT were at 128.76, down 0.47 from the prior close after touching a 129.00 high earlier.
Raynard Cheng at First Chicago said he saw immediate pressure at the 128.70 level, which the market was testing early on Thursday. He pegged resistance in the 129.00-10 area.
"I expect the market to weaken further and probe below 128.70 and the next support will be at 128.40," he said.
"But that level (128.40) is a strong barrier to a one-and-a-half point decline to 127.00."
Cheng said the short-term uptrend had been broken and had reached its reverse overnight.
"But if the market surprised me to rally above the 129.00-10 area we are looking for 129.40, 129.80 after that," he said.
Skelley said Wednesday's move past 129.05 resistance, which had been a pair of highs in mid-April, and then above 129.30, had been a false break. The market touched 129.35 on Wednesday.
She said a move below 128.40 would add to the bearish pressure and would target 128.15 immediately.
June Eurolire were also weighed down, trading at 93.20, down 0.05.
